intro: Daviesia brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grey saltbush, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring or early summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal and semi-arid environments. Daviesia brachyphylla is an important component of local ecosystems and is often used in rehabilitation projects due to its hardy nature.
